title: Restore persistent full-screen cruise ship image on homepage

requirements.text: Update the homepage Hero (frontend/src/components/Hero.tsx) so the cruise ship image is the single, full-viewport background for the entire front page hero area (covering width and height) and does not disappear after updates/deploys.

quotes: The picture is gone again.  Can we get the cruise ship picture for the entire front page

acceptanceCriteria: On the home page (no share link present), the Hero section renders a cruise ship photo that covers the full viewport (no letterboxing) using a cover-style layout.
The cruise ship image remains visible after a rebuild/redeploy (no regression where it disappears).
If the cruise ship image cannot be loaded, the UI shows a graceful visual fallback (e.g., a solid/gradient background) rather than an empty/blank hero area.

requirements.text: Ensure the cruise ship hero image asset is available as a static public asset and referenced consistently from the Hero component using the exact path /assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg.

quotes: Can we get the cruise ship picture for the entire front page

acceptanceCriteria: The file frontend/public/assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg exists in the project and is served by the frontend.
The Hero component uses /assets/generated/cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg as the background source (no broken links / 404s in browser devtools).

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui or other paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: No changes to backend canister logic or data models.
No changes to the shared itinerary page rendering (when a share link is present).

required: Cruise ship hero photo at sea, wide landscape (cruise-ship-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg)
